textArr:
The Waterfalls of The Main Range, starting in southern Thailand, ends near the southern tip of the Negri Sembilan state. 
From there on, landscape is that of isolated hills protruding from the plains. 
The outstanding and tallest among them is Gunung Ladang in North Johore.
Next, further south, the plain gives way to a series of rolling hills. 
The Endau Rompin Park, half in Johore and half in Pahang, can boast of a number of impressive waterfalls.
   
   


	   Accessability: Easy
	   
	   Picture
	   Name/Location
	   Type
	   Activities
	   Description
	   
	  
	  Ayer PutehSlope of Gunung Ledang, north of Sagil
	  Cascades
	  PicnicSwimming
	  Cascade near the Gunung Ledang Visitor Center. SeasonalLast update March 2013
	 
	  
	  Kota Tinggi15 km north-west of Kota Tinggi town
	  CascadesSingle fall
	  PicnicSwimmingCamping
	  Attractive waterfalls in over-commercialised surroundings. Ridiculous entrance feeLast update December 2005
	 
	  
	  Puteri FallBetween Tangkak and Labis
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Waterfall on the slopes of the Gunung Ledang. The Puteri Fall is a popular family destination. The upper fall requires trekking (guide compulsory)Last update April 2004
	 
	  
	  Sg Pulai15 km north of Pekan Nenas, on the slopes of Gunung Pulai
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Hardly visited, nice falls in derelict recreation parkLast update October 2012
	 
	  
	  Taka MelorKampung Tenang, near Labis
	  Single fall
	  PicnicSwimmingCamping
	  Hardly visited waterfall and unspoilt too due to its remote location.Last update July 2009
	 
	   Accessability: Moderate
	   
	   Picture
	   Name/Location
	   Type
	   Activities
	   Description
	   
	  
	  Asahan fallWestern slope of Gunung ledang
	  CascadesSingle fall
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Not a lot of water, but a nice poolLast update May 2012
	 
	  
	  Jeram TinggiKampung Ulu Jementah, Jementah
	  Cascades
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Waterfall on the northern slope of Gunung LedangLast update November 2012
	 
	  
	  Lemako FallsEndau Rompin National Park
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Unspoilt waterfalls in Endau Rompin N.P.Last update June 2008
	 
	  
	  Pelepah FallsNear Kota Tinggi
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Relatively unknown falls near the Kota Tinggi falls. Nice series of many falls and cascadesLast update June 2009
	 
	  
	  Selai fallsTaman Negara Endau Rompin, 20 km NE of Bekok
	  Multiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Waterfalls of the Selai river in an unknown part of Endau Rompin. Takah TInggi is an impressive fall, high volume. Smaller falls in tributariesLast update September 2012
	 
	  
	  Sg YongOn the slopes of Gunung Belumut, off the Kluang Mersing Road
	  Multiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  A seven tiers waterfall on the slopes of Gunung Belumut in pristine surroundingsLast update August 2013
	 
	  
	  Upeh GulingEndau Rompin National park
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  PicnicSwimmingTrekking
	  Impressive waterfall in the Jasin riverLast update June 2008
	 
	   Accessability: Difficult
	   
	   Picture
	   Name/Location
	   Type
	   Activities
	   Description
	   
	  
	  Buaya SangkutTaman Negara Endau Rompin
	  Multiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekkingCamping
	  Most people will visit this dramatic fall on a trekking along the river with overnight camping

Last update June 2008
	 
	  
	  Tengkil FallsNear Kota Tinggi
	  CascadesMultiple falls
	  SwimmingTrekking
	  Remote series of cascades and falls. Unspoilt.Last update June 2009
